name: John Green
bio: Bestselling author of 'The Fault in Our Stars' and 'Looking for Alaska'. Known for his poignant and emotionally resonant young adult novels.

name: J.K. Rowling
bio: Renowned British author, creator of the 'Harry Potter' series. Her magical world captivates readers of all ages.

name: Stephen King
bio: Master of horror and suspense, Stephen King has written numerous bestsellers, including 'The Shining', 'It', and 'Carrie'.

name: Haruki Murakami
bio: Japanese author known for his surreal and imaginative storytelling. Works include 'Norwegian Wood' and 'Kafka on the Shore'.

name: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
bio: Nigerian author and feminist known for her novels 'Half of a Yellow Sun' and 'Americanah'. A powerful voice in contemporary literature.

name: Jane Austen
bio: Classic English novelist known for her timeless works such as 'Pride and Prejudice' and 'Sense and Sensibility'.

name: Gabriel García Márquez
bio: Colombian author and Nobel Prize winner, famous for his magical realism. Notable works include 'One Hundred Years of Solitude'.

name: Margaret Atwood
bio: Canadian author acclaimed for dystopian novels like 'The Handmaid's Tale'. A prominent voice in feminist literature.

name: George Orwell
bio: English novelist and essayist known for political allegories like 'Animal Farm' and the dystopian classic '1984'.

name: Agatha Christie
bio: Queen of mystery and detective fiction, Agatha Christie is the best-selling novelist of all time. Famous for characters like Hercule Poirot and Miss Marple.

name: Ernest Hemingway
bio: Nobel Prize-winning American novelist and short story writer. Notable works include 'The Old Man and the Sea' and 'A Farewell to Arms'.

name: Maya Angelou
bio: Renowned American poet, memoirist, and civil rights activist. Her autobiographical work 'I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings' is a classic.

name: Toni Morrison
bio: Nobel Prize-winning American novelist celebrated for works like 'Beloved' and 'Song of Solomon'. A leading voice in African American literature.

name: Gabriel Garcia Bernal
bio: Chilean author and director known for his works exploring themes of identity, politics, and social issues.

name: J.R.R. Tolkien
bio: English writer and philologist, creator of the epic fantasy world of Middle-earth. Famous for 'The Hobbit' and 'The Lord of the Rings' trilogy.

name: Leo Tolstoy
bio: Russian author and philosopher, best known for his novels 'War and Peace' and 'Anna Karenina'. A key figure in world literature.

name: Alice Walker
bio: American novelist and activist, famous for 'The Color Purple'. Her works often address issues of race, gender, and social justice.

name: Kazuo Ishiguro
bio: Nobel Prize-winning British author known for his poignant novels such as 'Never Let Me Go' and 'The Remains of the Day'.

name: Herman Melville
bio: American author best known for his masterpiece 'Moby-Dick'. His works explore themes of obsession, morality, and the human condition.

name: Virginia Woolf
bio: English writer and modernist, known for her novels 'Mrs. Dalloway' and 'To the Lighthouse'. A pioneer of stream-of-consciousness writing.

name: Mark Twain
bio: Iconic American author and humorist, famous for 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer' and 'Adventures of Huckleberry Finn'. A literary giant of the 19th century.
